summary: The White Stripes were an American rock band from Detroit, active from 1997 to 2011. The duo, Jack and Meg White, gained popularity in the 2000s with their unique blend of indie rock and garage rock. They released six albums, with "White Blood Cells" and "Elephant" being their most acclaimed. Known for their simple, raw sound and distinctive style, they won six Grammy Awards and were nominated for the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 2023.
title: The White Stripes
